title: CEO Overconfidence and Corporate Innovation Investment
research_question: Does CEO overconfidence lead to greater corporate R&D investment and more patent filings, and if so, does this result in higher or lower quality innovations?
hypothesis: Overconfident CEOs invest more in R&D because they overestimate the probability of innovation success. However, this leads to lower quality innovations on average due to insufficient project screening.
data_sources: Compustat, CRSP, USPTO patent database, Execucomp for CEO characteristics
key_variables: Dependent: R&D intensity, patent count, patent citations. Independent: CEO overconfidence (option-based measure), firm size, Tobin's Q
methodology: Panel regression with firm and year fixed effects. Use option-based overconfidence measure following Malmendier and Tate (2005).
related_literature: Malmendier and Tate (2005, 2008), Hirshleifer et al. (2012), Galasso and Simcoe (2011)
expected_contribution: First paper to examine the quality dimension of overconfidence-driven innovation

title: Climate Risk and Municipal Bond Pricing
research_question: How do physical climate risks affect municipal bond yields and credit ratings?
data_description: Municipal bond transactions from MSRB, matched with county-level climate risk scores from FEMA and First Street Foundation.
data_sources: MSRB, FEMA National Risk Index, First Street Foundation flood risk data
key_variables: Bond yield spreads, climate risk scores, county demographics
constraints: Must be under 10 pages for short article format

title: Algorithmic Trading and Price Discovery in Options Markets
research_question: Does algorithmic trading improve or impair price discovery in equity options markets, and how does this vary across moneyness and maturity?
hypothesis: Algorithmic trading improves price discovery for at-the-money options but has neutral or negative effects for deep out-of-the-money options due to lower liquidity.
methodology: Variance ratio tests, Hasbrouck information shares, difference-in-differences around exchange technology upgrades
related_literature: Hendershott et al. (2011), Boehmer et al. (2021), Muravyev et al. (2013)
expected_contribution: First comprehensive study of algorithmic trading effects in options markets

title: Private Equity Fund Performance and GP Experience
research_question: How does general partner experience affect private equity fund returns, and is there persistence in GP performance?
data_description: Preqin private equity fund data from 2000-2023, including fund IRR, multiples, and GP track records.
key_variables: Fund IRR, TVPI, DPI, GP experience (years, number of prior funds), fund size, vintage year
methodology: Panel regression with vintage year fixed effects. PME benchmarking against public market indices.
related_literature: Kaplan and Schoar (2005), Harris et al. (2014), Korteweg and Sorensen (2017)
expected_contribution: Updated evidence on GP performance persistence using post-GFC data

title: Social Media Sentiment and Retail Trading
research_question: Does social media sentiment on platforms like Reddit and Twitter predict retail trading flows and subsequent stock returns?
hypothesis: Positive social media sentiment leads to increased retail buying, which temporarily pushes prices above fundamental values, followed by return reversals.
related_literature: Cookson et al. (2023), Barber et al. (2022)
constraints: Short article, focus on meme stock episode of 2021

title: Bank Stress Tests and Credit Supply
research_question: Do bank stress test results affect credit supply to small businesses, and do effects differ between pass and fail banks?
hypothesis: Banks that perform poorly in stress tests reduce lending to small businesses more than banks that pass, even controlling for actual capital ratios.
data_description: CRA small business lending data matched with CCAR/DFAST stress test results 2011-2023.
data_sources: FFIEC CRA data, Federal Reserve stress test results, Call Reports
key_variables: Small business loan originations, stress test performance, bank capital ratios, bank size
methodology: Difference-in-differences comparing lending before and after stress test announcements for pass vs. marginal fail banks.
related_literature: Acharya et al. (2018), Cort√©s et al. (2020), Berrospide and Edge (2019)
expected_contribution: First paper to isolate the informational effect of stress test results from actual capital constraints

title: ESG Ratings Disagreement and Stock Volatility
research_question: Does disagreement across ESG rating providers increase stock return volatility?
data_sources: MSCI, Sustainalytics, Refinitiv ESG ratings, CRSP
key_variables: ESG rating dispersion, realized volatility, implied volatility, trading volume
methodology: Panel regression with firm and time fixed effects
related_literature: Berg et al. (2022), Gibson et al. (2021)
expected_contribution: Connect ESG rating disagreement literature to volatility research

title: Cryptocurrency Market Microstructure
research_question: How do market microstructure characteristics differ between centralized and decentralized cryptocurrency exchanges?
hypothesis: Decentralized exchanges have wider spreads and higher price impact but lower adverse selection costs due to transparent on-chain order flow.
data_description: High-frequency trading data from Binance (centralized) and Uniswap (decentralized) for major trading pairs.
key_variables: Bid-ask spread, price impact, order flow toxicity, trading volume
methodology: Compare microstructure metrics using matched samples. Decompose spreads using Glosten-Harris model.
related_literature: Makarov and Schoar (2020), Lehar and Parlour (2021), Capponi and Jia (2021)
expected_contribution: First systematic comparison of market quality between CEX and DEX
